latest-posts.title: How to stop recurring dreams and why do we have them
latest-posts.body:
Bad dreams are exactly what the name suggests - dreams that we wake up from feeling anxious, scared, sad, or even disgusted. Pretty straightforward. Recurring dreams are dreams that keep coming back to us in our life. When bad dreams become recurring, they can cause a lot of stress and lead to sleep deprivation. In turn, sleep deprivation is a major risk to our health, being linked to everything from weight gain to heart disease. 

We know you just want to learn how to stop these dreams from happening, so let’s have a closer look at what they are and how you can stop them.

Why Do We Have Recurring Dreams?

The most common theory is that recurring dreams occur from stress in our daily life, or from childhood traumas (or both). There are common themes that many people dream about. For example, many people report dreams such as getting to an exam and realizing they haven’t studied - even years after they have finished school! Others have dreams about being chased, attacked or falling.

Many theories suggest that dreams have an adaptive purpose. They help us work through the events in our lives and better prepare for future threats. Some say that “practicing” possible situations through recurring dreams allows us to make better choices, should these scenarios actually occur. 

A theory popularized by Freud is that dreams are a reflection of our suppressed feelings, fears, and desires. Studies have found that ongoing stress is felt in our body and can lead to an increase in bad dreams, nightmares, and insomnia.

So, how can we stop having recurring dreams?

Start with keeping a dream journal. It will help you see if your dreams really are recurring, and what are the themes and details that keep popping up in them. That will give you your first clues about what is causing these dreams to keep on appearing. Keep a notebook and pen beside your bed, so you can write as soon as you wake up. Include the date and as many details as you can remember about your dream.

Consider what is bringing you stress in your daily life, or what you might be trying to suppress. Everyone has things we’d rather not think about, but if we refuse to give them any space at all, they will find some other way to be on our mind.  It can help to set aside a certain amount of time to think about what it is that is worrying you. Then, after your “worry hour” is up, you can go back to trying to avoid the topic.

Talk about the things that are bothering you. The less you bottle up inside, is one less thing that will need to find some other creative way to pop up. Whether it’s the dreams themselves or what you suspect is causing them, it can help to get it off your chest. You might surprise yourself by how good it feels.

Don’t forget to take care of your body. Exercising regularly and eating a clean, healthy diet will help regulate the stress hormones in your body, making you less likely to get bad dreams. Pay extra close attention to what you eat before going to bed. Some people say that certain foods - like cheese, spicy food, or white flour such as bread and pasta - make them more likely to have bad dreams.

Take up activities to reduce stress in your life, such as yoga, meditation and breathing exercises. Similarly to exercise, this will calm your body down and help you achieve deeper, more relaxing sleep.

It might take some time until you feel the effects, but if you practice these habits consistently, your sleep quality can improve.
latest-posts.excerpt: Bad dreams are exactly what the name suggests - dreams that we wake up from feeling anxious, scared, sad, or even disgusted. Pretty straightforward. Recurring dreams are dreams that keep coming back to us in our life.

latest-posts.title: How to overcome bad dreams at night
latest-posts.body:
Bad dreams can be a real burden. Waking up sweating, with your heart pounding, unable to fall back asleep for hours at a time. Many develop sleeping anxiety and start to suffer from insomnia. Lying awake for hours, with nothing to look forward to but waking up shortly after falling asleep from another nightmare, can seem like torture. 

Beyond the unpleasantness of it, suffering from bad dreams can lead to sleep deprivation, which is downright dangerous. While eight hours of sleep is recommended, many people get much less on a daily basis. After several days of not getting enough sleep, tiredness and brain fog increases - as does your risk of accidents. 

Sleep is essential to keep your body running optimally, and when you don’t get enough sleep, all systems start to suffer. Sleep deprivation can cause issues within your digestive system and immune system. That can lead to weight gain and susceptibility to various diseases and illnesses. Sleep deprivation is correlated with heart disease, diabetes, and more.

Even if you know how essential sleep it, it can be hard to get enough when you are suffering from constant bad dreams. Here are some tips to minimize the appearance of bad dreams in your life. We hope it helps.

●Timing Matters… Don’t eat right before going to sleep. Many people report a correlation between eating at bedtime and having bad dreams. Have a regular bedtime, and make sure to eat dinner at least two hours before. 
●...And So Does Content. Make sure your last meal is healthy, and not too heavy. Avoid alcohol, dairy, sugary foods (like cake, cookies and ice cream), white bread and pasta. Try a meal rich in vegetable and complex carbs like whole grains or potatoes. For example, try a big quinoa salad, or a baked potato with non-spicy lentil curry. Almonds and chamomile tea are reported to be sleep-promoting.
●Practice sleep hygiene. Try to avoid screens for at least an hour before going to bed. Make sure your room is well ventilated and try to keep your sleeping hours as regular as possible. Use your bed for sleep (and sex) only. Find another place to work and study. It’s worth it.
●Air out your troubles. Stress and repressed feelings are a major cause of nightmares. Therapy, a journaling practice and talking to trusted people about your problems may alleviate some of your concerns. This way, your problems are less likely to show up in your sleep.
●Breathing practices and meditation. Take measures to find a practice to help you manage the stress in your daily life. Apps like Insight Talmer, Headspace and Calm have guided meditations that can help you relax and drift off to sleep.
●Exercise. Cardiovascular exercise is known to improve quality of sleep. It works not only by reducing the amount of stress in your life but also helps regulate your cardiovascular system. Remember thatit might take several weeks until you feel the benefits of exercise on the quality of your sleep. Try to exercise early in the day, as the adrenaline from exercise can make it harder on some to fall asleep when they workout too close to bedtime. 
●Talk about the dream and rewrite the ending. When you have recurring bad dreams, it might be helpful to consider different ways the dream could have gone. Write down your dream and then think about different ways the dream could have gone. Let’s say you have a dream in which you are attacked by a bear. When you write or think about this dream, you can practice thinking about the bear as a puppy or giant teddy bear instead. If you have a dream that your teacher fails you because you brought in the wrong pencil, you can imagine confronting them. Practicing these alternatives frequently enough can bring them into your dreams the next time they occur. You can do this by yourself or with a trained therapist.

If the above suggestions don’t offer you any relief, it may be time to see a sleep specialist. In a sleep clinic, a specialist will monitor your sleep and will be able to offer you alternative solutions, such as medication, CBT (Cognitive Behavioral Therapy) and more.
latest-posts.excerpt: Bad dreams can be a real burden. Waking up sweating, with your heart pounding, unable to fall back asleep for hours at a time. Many develop sleeping anxiety and start to suffer from insomnia.

latest-posts.title: Why do we have bad dreams
latest-posts.body:
Every night we go to sleep and we dream.  We dream every time we sleep. While some people say they don’t dream, the truth is they likely don’t remember their dreams. We tend to have around four to six dreams a night, mainly during the REM (rapid eye movement) stage of sleep. 

Some people remember their dreams often, whilst others rarely do. Dreams are easier to remember when they are particularly vivid or emotional. That's why people find it easier to recall recurring dreams, bad dreams or nightmares. Unfortunately, bad dreams are unpleasant - and being able to remember them isn't a big enough perk.

Most people who have bad dreams would like to stop having them. The problem arises because our dreams are out of our direct control. Sigmund Freud, one of the most influential people in the field of Psychology, claimed our dreams are a representation of repressed desires. By working with a psychoanalyst, one could understand their hidden desires and solve the problem. Thus, they would be able to stop having bad dreams. Whilst many of Freud’s theories have been discredited, there seems to be a lot behind his theory of repression and dreams. 

Bad dreams and nightmares are a common symptom of PTSD (post-traumatic stress disorder). Up to 96% of people diagnosed with PTSD suffer from nightmares. These nightmares often include re-experiencing the trauma at the root of their PTSD. Of course, it doesn’t take a PTSD diagnosis to have bad dreams. People from all over the world have bad dreams during different parts of their lives. 50-85% of adults reported having nightmares. Between 2% and 8% seem to have nightmares regularly. 

The terms bad dreams and nightmares are often used interchangeably. By definition, people wake up from nightmares but sleep through bad dreams. That said, the line between bad dreams and nightmares is quite thin. At the end of the day, there is not much difference between them. People report common themes in nightmares and bad dreams. The death of a close person or the sensation of someone chasing you are frequent themes. Often, bad dreams are recurring. People will have the same dream over and over, or the same general story with several variations. For example, someone might dream of several different ways they fail a test. One night they might dream they show up to the test without pencils. The next week they might dream that they only found out about a test an hour before. Often, people wake up from bad dreams and are unable to fall asleep again because they feel disturbed. 

Why do we have bad dreams? 
With all that said, what is the reason we have bad dreams and nightmares? Some medications (like anti-depressants and blood pressure medications) can increase the frequency of bad dreams. Other substances, like alcohol, can have a similar effect.

If you’re not taking any medication or drinking alcohol, there are other causes to look at. 

Sleep deprivation can also increase the likelihood of bad dreams. Unfortunately, nightmares can interfere with sleep and cause even more sleep deprivation.

As mentioned, PTSD can cause nightmares in adults. Depression and anxiety can also increase the likelihood of bad dreams, as can general life stress. A busy time at work or a big fight with a family member can influence our dreams. Even if the stressful events in our lives aren’t the topic of our bad dreams, they can still be the cause.

Of course, it’s impossible to completely prevent stress in our lives. In fact, some stress can be positive. So what can we do to prevent bad dreams from appearing?

Like Freud suggested, things from our daily lives are more likely to show up in bad dreams if we try to ignore them. Having a safe space to reflect on the events in our lives is important, and can cut down on or even prevent bad dreams. 

Understanding the cause of the bad dreams in our lives is an important step to getting a peaceful nights’ sleep.
latest-posts.excerpt: Every night we go to sleep and we dream.  We dream every time we sleep. While some people say they don’t dream, the truth is they likely don’t remember their dreams.

latest-posts.title: Why do I keep having nightmares
latest-posts.body:
Many adults and children suffer from nightmares. While nightmares are more common in children, up to 85% of adults report that they sometimes have nightmares. That fact offers little comfort to the person who is waking up in the middle of the night in a panic. It’s not only the fact that nightmares are unpleasant. Having nightmares can lead to a lack of sleep. Often, people will feel that they are unable to fall back asleep after a nightmare. The resulting sleep deprivation can cause all sorts of problems. From a lack of focus at work to an increase in the risk of car accidents and even disease. Not getting enough sleep can be risky.

Because nightmares often lead to sleep deprivation, it increases the stress in our daily life. Of course, more stress in life increases the risk of having more nightmares. To the nightmare suffer, it seems to be an endless loop with no end in sight.

To stop having nightmares, it is important to understand why we have them in the first place. Yet, sometimes it is hard to understand why the nightmares come. They seem to appear out of nowhere and will take up residence in our sleep for days, weeks or even months at a time. We want to get rid of them - but it’s hard to know where to start if we don’t understand why they appear in the first place!

So, Why Do I Keep Having Nightmares?

Several potential causes of nightmares have been identified, based on people’s reports and scientific studies. 

●Medication. Certain types of medication can cause nightmares as a side effect. Many types of medications can interfere with dreams. For example, anti-depressants such as SSRIs, medication for blood pressure (beta-blockers) or cholesterol, medication for Alzheimer’s and Parkinson's, sleeping aids and more. Please consult your doctor if you are currently taking any medication and suspect that they might be contributing to your nightmares. Keep in mind that withdrawal from medication can also cause nightmares. 
●Was It Something You Ate? Some people report having nightmares when they eat right before sleep, or when they eat certain foods. Cheese and other dairy products, foods high in sugar, and spicy food have all been reported to cause nightmares in some. Alcohol can also be a cause of stressful dreams and nightmares. You can start to keep a food and sleep blog to notice any trends between what you consume and what you dream.
●Stress and trauma. Many people start having nightmares after going through a traumatic experience, such as a car accident, physical assault, or military service. For others, it is not a single traumatic event but a period of stress. It’s not a coincidence that university students tend to have nightmares around the exam period or that others experience bad dreams during a busy time at work when they are working long hours.
●Depression, anxiety, PTSD and sleep disorders. Some people struggle with certain conditions in their day to day life that make nightmares more likely. Sleep apnea and restless leg syndrome have been linked to increased nightmares. If nightmares are recurring, they can themselves be classified as a disorder. Getting a diagnosis and treatment for these underlying conditions and reduce the frequency of the nightmares.

If you have regular nightmares (once a week or more), your nightmares are severe, or you are unable to understand why you have nightmares, it may be time to see a specialist. You can make an appointment with a sleep clinic. There, you can undergo tests and a specialist can help you come up with possible solutions.
latest-posts.excerpt: Many adults and children suffer from nightmares. While nightmares are more common in children, up to 85% of adults report that they sometimes have nightmares.

latest-posts.title: How to cope up with nightmares
latest-posts.body:
For many people, nightmares are a major barrier to a good night’s sleep. Getting enough sleep is necessary for your body to operate as it should. While the amount of sleep you need differs from person to person, it’s generally recommended that adults get between 7 to 9 hours of sleep a night.  In today’s fast-paced world, it’s common to “get by” on a lot less. Many people are so sleep-deprived, they don’t even notice the effects on their bodies! Some people even brag about how little they sleep, or how they “run on coffee”. 

Sleep is so essential, that not getting enough sleep is correlated to everything from weight gain, to heart disease, weakening of the immune system, distractibility that can lead to increased risk of accidents, and much more. 

Nightmares in adults can be caused by certain types of medication; PTSD, depression, anxiety or sleep disorders; stress and more. 

What can you do when you’re struggling with sleep deprivation due to recurring nightmares?

●Get out of bed. Don’t torture yourself by lying in bed for hours after waking up from a nightmare. If you can’t fall back asleep, get out of bed. Make yourself some chamomile tea, go for a five-minute walk or take a shower. Doing this can give your body and mind a kind of “reset” that will help you fall back asleep quickly. 
●Keep a dream journal. When you wake up from a dream, write down everything you can remember about it. You’ll probably find out common themes that keep showing up in the nightmares. When you identify these themes, you can look closely at your life and deal with the issues. 
●Talk it out. Bottling things up makes them have a stronger hold on you. In addition to the relief you’ll feel from letting things out, talking to someone else about your nightmares can offer you a different perspective, and perhaps some solution. Maybe you see no connection between your dreams and what’s going on in your life. A friend or therapist can offer some ideas. 
●Practice good sleep hygiene. Some people report having nightmares after eating too close to bedtime. Making sure you have a regular sleeping schedule and practice sleep hygiene can improve your overall quality of sleep. Make sure you only use your bed for sleeping and having sex. Eat your last meal several hours before going to bed, and avoid screens (TV, computers, and smartphones) for at least an hour before going to sleep. Keep your room well ventilated and make sure it is not too hot or cold. 
●Take active steps to reduce stress in your life. Whether that’s making sure you don’t bite off more than you can chew (you really don’t have to accept every invitation) or adopting new stress-busting habits, this is an important step. Stress is one of the main causes of nightmares in adults. Yoga isn’t the only thing you can do. Try different forms of exercise, breathing techniques, and meditation. 
●See a specialist. If your nightmares are recurring and are seriously getting in the way of your everyday life, it’s time to see a specialist. First, you can discuss with your doctor if any medication you take might be the cause of your nightmares and find another course of action. If you’re not on any medication or are unable to change the medication you take, your doctor might refer you to a sleep specialist. 

Dealing with recurring nightmares is a horrible experience. The stress from experiencing nightmares can unfortunately make nightmares even more likely to occur. We hope that these tips can help you break out of this negative pattern.
latest-posts.excerpt: For many people, nightmares are a major barrier to a good night’s sleep. Getting enough sleep is necessary for your body to operate as it should.

latest-posts.title: How to throw the best bachelor party
latest-posts.body:
The famous bachelor party will be the most anticipated night of a man 's life, except his wedding day, of course. But it is not only yet another night of debauchery that is perfect before marriage for the groom to be, but instead a night for many guys to be just guys.

As Best Man, you need this to be a night for the man getting married to enjoy, as well as for all to recall at the same time.

Groundwork
Preparation for the nighttime has become the most crucial measure -- this is where all of the strategies are laid out for the magic to take place.

The guest list
So that you can make sure that you are not forgetting anyone significant (or inviting others who did not get an invitation in the mail), strategize the guest list with the bridegroom, or, at least, have him study the list himself ahead of time. Include the bridegroom's best friends, relatives and others that only must be invited from politeness.

Now comes the girls; the essence of a bachelor party is there are no girls. However, that does not mean you cannot have a few of those crazy pals that are female you'll all have had a good time with. I am not talking about inviting the bride's friends -- in no way should the female guests be linked to the bride -- this cannot be stressed enough. Invite some party girls that have no connection to your daily life, the girls who constantly need to be present to get a great time. 

Where you are going
This typically comprises of a strip joint, a strip club, oh, and did I mention the club of a gentleman? The nighttime may also involve a restaurant, a casino, his favourite pub, and you also might want to cap off the night time in a hotel room (the best of the best) or rent a penthouse, unless someone is courageous enough to offer his pad.

Transport
To be able to order how you will get from place to place, it is crucial that you understand where the party is headed all night -- no designated drivers permitted. To ensure no one needs to be concerned about how much they drank, rent a limousine for your friends, not minding if the champagne is flowing.

You have got the peoples; you have got the venues -- what is next?

Additional expenses
Forewarn the type of staff at every establishment which you're holding a bachelor party so that they will not be surprised when your colleagues begin approaching all the girls present to give them a little spanking as you will most likely be a loud and obnoxious group. Give whoever's in charge a tiny bit of extra coin for specific treatment as soon as you arrive at every celebration place. Including your limousine driver, do it before the night starts.
Also, ensure that you set aside some funds in the event you're liable for any additional costs.

Food and beverage
Be sure to have sufficient food and booze to keep everyone smiling, in the event you are spending all the night time in a hotel room or flat. You do not want an elaborate meal; only finger food and lots of bubbly.

More things to put into consideration:
Make it a night he will always recall
You will give the bridegroom something unique to keep in mind the night after, besides making all of the arrangements for the bachelor party. No, not a stripper's phone number, however, a video montage of his life or his relationship past, as an example, you could reveal to everyone in the celebration.

Simply have fun
So once all the organizations are done, kick back and revel in the festivities. 
Don't forget, the bachelor party isn't likely to make the bridegroom get cold feet, or think about getting married for anxiety about missing the single life. However, it does not mean he cannot get one last taste of it.

latest-posts.title: What is actuaries science and its scope
latest-posts.body:
Actuarial science makes use of mathematical and statistical techniques to evaluate risk in insurance and finance sectors. Experts that engage in this science of examining financial impacts of unforeseen circumstances are called actuaries. There are great job openings with actuarial science, and it also offers outstanding salary packages.

Course outlook
Aspirants of this wonderful course can obtain a degree in both graduate and postgraduate levels. Some of the certifications are M.Sc. in Actuarial Science, B.Sc. in Actuarial Science and Post Graduate Diploma in Actuarial Science among others.
In order to study any undergraduate course in actuarial science, a candidate is expected to complete their 12th with mathematics from a licensed board. Candidates that have successfully finished their undergraduate course in the related field can go on to study actuarial science. The university you plan to enter will be the determinant of the requirements, such as the minimum marks required. There are some colleges and universities that conduct their own tests and exams to fish out candidates that are eligible for the course. 
There are several actuarial science colleges all over the world, and in India, some of them are:
-	University of Kalyani, West Bengal
-	Berhampur University, Orissa
-	DS Actuarial Education Services, Mumbai
-	Goa University, Goa
-	Kurukshetra University, Kurukshetra
-	Gurunanak Dev University, Amritsar
-	Andhra University, Visakhapatnam
-	University of Mumbai, Mumbai
-	Annamalai University, Tamil Nadu
-	Birla Institute of Management Technology, New Delhi
-	University of Madras, Chennai
-	RNIS College of Insurance, New Delhi

Scope in various sectors
Many business, both small and big requires the service of actuaries. Even social events and contexts require actuaries. Some of the sectors in which actuaries have key roles are:
-	Investment and Financial Services
-	Employee Retirement and Benefit Plans
-	Health Insurance
-	General Insurances
-	Vehicle Insurance
-	Life Insurance

Other sectors that actuaries are important to are:

-	Asset Liability management in many sectors
-	Pension Funds
-	Banks
-	Investment firms
-	Risk Management
-	Rating Agencies
-	Health care sectors
-	Education sectors
-	BPO
-	Project Management
-	Hospitals

Roles of actuaries
We have just listed the sectors that requires the services of actuaries, so what role do actuaries play in the listed sectors? What do they do? Well, there are many roles actuaries play in the above listed sectors, and their roles include Financial Insurance Consultants in IT sector, Insurance risk managers, Assistant Administrative Officer, Risk analysts, Administrating officer, and BPO administrator. They also perform the following roles: Actuary Director, General Officer, Financial Service Executive, Finance consultants in various Insurance sectors, Appointed Actuary, Actuarial Analyst and Health care directors/managers analysts. From the listed roles, you can see that actuarial science is important in many sectors. The roles actuaries play in financial and other sectors are huge, and in addition to the listed ones, here are other roles they fill: Accounts manager, Pension Providing administrator (other than in Insurance companies), Senior Actuarial Analyst and Asset Liability manager.
Insurance companies, banks, healthcare centers and also private firms provide job opportunities for actuaries. Actuarial science is a wonderful course worthy of studying.

latest-posts.title: Check out what the most skillful luxury SUV, the 2016 range rover HSE Td6 can do
latest-posts.body:
The initial strategy was to take a quick jaunt up the coast to the enchanting town of Providence, Rhode Island together with the wife and pup in tow for 36 hours of relaxation. Getting the new 2016 Range Rover HSE Td6 at our disposal looked like an ideal getaway vehicle: luxurious, cozy, quiet and sturdy enough to handle any potholes on the highway. A spell of wet weather might have derailed our strategies of relaxation, but it brought a new off-road rendezvous where we could test the latest Variety out and find out what its motor could manage.

Among the key parameters for our evaluation of the newest Rover was to check out the range of its Td6 diesel motor—which supplies unprecedented fuel economy to get a 5,485-pound high-end beast. With up to 25 mpg put together and up to 658 miles of accessible mileage per tank of fuel, the turbocharged Td6 shows this Range Rover to function as the most opportunistic of the whole lineup.

A 3.0-liter V6 engine is the keystone of the Td6. Though it provides a small 254 horsepower, besides, it boasts 440 lb.-ft. of torque at a lowly 1,750 rpm. It’s this kind of torque—with their infamous four-wheel drive—that propelled us through the stone-laden woods of Northern New Jersey. Using a more modern take on the original iron engine block, the Compacted Graphite Iron (CGI) is smaller and lighter than its counterpart, which makes it compact in nature.

Considering that the recent launch of the Td6 motor, customer adoption surpassed, or has equaled Land Rover’s expectancies. latest-posts.title: 6 easy steps to be environmentally conscious with your luxurious yacht
latest-posts.body:
As worries about climate change continue to reverberate across the world, individual, lifestyle and every business stands to be improved, irrespective of political persuasion and socioeconomic status. With rising sea levels and dangerous storms getting more frequent, yacht owners are finding themselves increasingly inquisitive concerning the processes by which they, also, can participate in making environmentally friendly selections. Here are six ways you may make eco-aware selections in hopes that by simply doing this, it is possible to remain gladly at your helms for a long time to come:

Contemplate about fabric
Fabric structures can provide a great deal in the sustainability section—notably as slip covers or for long term dry storage demands. Selecting carbon material over more conventional building materials stands to lower your carbon footprint nearly instantly. In the translucence of stuff that enables the sun to fill space during the day to site preparation that is less, light, heat and the energy needed to assemble a fabric structure is often rather small.

Purchase an Eco-Friendly Yacht
Whether you believe it or not, there are plenty of eco friendly—or at least eco-friendlier—high-end yacht choices out there. Much of the design is based on the hull and the building, but at the very top of the list is the efficiency of fuel that cuts down on emissions. For a lot of people, nevertheless, the need to be more environmentally conscious must be weighed against whether or not such a yacht may continue to be luxurious. As greener and more eco-friendly boats, as well as superyachts, reach the marketplace, it is becoming more and more clear that extravagance and environmental concerns needn't be mutually exclusive.

More eco-friendly Propulsion
More eco-friendly propulsion is one huge manner yachts have become more eco-friendly. From diesel engines which are more fuel efficient to water jets that have substantially lower emissions, many layouts are utilizing mixture propulsion strategies on the requirements the user; propulsion can change together with the flip of a switch. When speed and power are essential, a more conventional propulsion might be a choice, but when a lower cruising speed could be used, changing over to some more eco-friendly setting makes lots of sense—not only from an environmental standpoint but a fuel savings one as well.

Solar
Especially when it comes to powering a high-end boat, solar energy continues its rise as an excellent way to obtain energy. From illumination to refrigeration, the electrical power needed to the open sea can, for the large part, be managed by well-placed solar cells. Solar will be an alternative that can work on overcast days as storage capacity and batteries get better and better.

Raise Consciousness
It might be true the vast bulk of enthusiasts and owners might not come from the stereotypically tree-hugging set. However, there is no reason that cannot transform. There is more than enough room on the table for anybody who is thinking about joining the dialogue about environmentalism and climate change. One easy solution to make possessing a luxurious boat more eco-friendly would be to raise consciousness. Even merely a quick conversation here and there with others in the club may get an optimistic impact about what folks begin to anticipate from their boats. A rise in consciousness will raise demand, which, will certainly escalate the way to obtain eco-friendly alternatives.

Fuel Efficiency
Probably the most crucial on the list is fuel efficiency. It might not look like it, but technology and eco-consciousness are affecting the appearance of the greatest superyachts as more and more buyers come to anticipate lower gasoline consumption and more extensive varieties.

There you go! You can handle the issues facing the earth and can keep your yacht at once.

latest-posts.title: The Scarlet: a Posh boutique hotel in Singapore
latest-posts.body:
Singapore is a lively and exciting city which is both classy and cosmopolitan in addition to hot and slightly naughty. This dynamic character can be utilized to refer to The Scarlet Singapore, an 80-room mischievous ultra-posh resort in Lion City. Scarlet is the property’s muse and fictional character —think about a maid in fishnets, stilettos, and a garter belt. She's the theory which drives the resort’s ethos, layout, and expertise.

This property is that of attitude, but its audacious guise, lavish décor, and its bold colours aren't for everybody. Situated in the Ann Siang Hill neighborhood that is fashionable, it's among the best destinations in Singapore for well-known expats who flock to the region throughout the week to get a meal that is nice or during weekends for a few late night fun. Specialty shops, fashionable restaurants, and wine bars surround it, using its labyrinth of hawker stores selling affordable and cheerful dishes and a block away you will find Chinatown. Nearby is the city’s bustling financial district you’ll find businesspeople, as well as women, rushing from one assembly to another.

Scarlet's ruby red façade is unbelievably different from the white and grey colours of its contiguous buildings. The lobby is furnished with velvet high back seats and materials in garnet reds cobalt and chartreuse mustard. An intricate chandelier; bejeweled, dark red and upholstered wall in the reception space; as well as a drawing room with period pieces, lovely antiques, art, and books come together to form this sexy and visually-exciting surroundings.

The resort is masterfully hewn from what was once living quarters in the early 1900s for women factory workers. The part of Scarlet is a vivacious host dripping with jewelry, certainly presents from her gentlemen callers that are adoring. This layout theory is interpreted into a property overflowing with opulent and sparkling layers of details.

The 75 rooms and five suites are spread over six floors of row houses that are linked. The hallways are very long, sloping and narrow with leather saddle bags on each and every door for keeping a note from the staff or the day's paper. The interesting thing about boutique hotels that are recovered from the past is the fact that no two rooms are alike. Each has differing shapes and a distinct nature, some with verandas that are excellent and walkout patios, other with views of the red rooftops of the surrounding buildings or of the downtown region. However, what they all have in common is their nature that is provocative.

All rooms have excellent décor with whimsical and tasteful graphics, king size beds with flitting on high-end, and headboards amenities. The furnishings are practical works of art with swirling plush velvet materials and design details. Named Opulent Swank, Munificent, Splendour and Fire, the five suites offer modern sophistication with a few boasting big balconies and separate sitting rooms.

The resort has two notable dining choices with its first being Casa Tartufo: an intimate, family-run Italian restaurant focusing on truffle dishes. It isn't an excessively challenging site but instead an honest and bona fide eatery offering food that is truly excellent. There's a chef's kitchen as good for little soirées or cooking exhibitions. Together with his wife, the eatery’s chef also manage Aria upstairs, an al fresco space -style Italian varieties.

The Scarlet is a real boutique property drenched in tradition and history. It is expensive, using a design theory that is powerful, and is ideal for all those looking to escape the foreseeable cookie-cutter hotel experience. Although It’s not for all, that's precisely what causes it to be so intriguing.

latest-posts.title: 10 Universities in the US offering top distance education
latest-posts.body:
Do you aspire to study in a U.S university from home? If yes, this post is for you. There are many top U.S universities offering distance education, and we will list top 10 U.S universities offering distance learning:
1.Boston university
 As a non-profit university in the United States and one of the largest, Boston university has strived to develop a reliable online higher education learning platform. The US based university offers a wide range of online diplomas, graduate programs, some online doctorate program, and undergraduate degree completion program as well as non-credit professional certificates. 

2.University of Florida
This is a top American university and always ranks among the top 20 best American public universities. University of Florida distance learning boosts of over 300,000 alumni in over 135 countries. It also offers both undergraduate and graduate degrees through online and distance learning in various fields ranging from engineering, agriculture, pharmacy and even business administration degrees.

3.Arizona state university
Arizona state university is a popular U.S based university that offers almost 100 bachelors and masters degrees in different disciplines ranging from social sciences, business, public and medical services. Arizona state university also offers online certificate programs both for graduates and for undergraduates. 

4.University of Wisconsin-Madison
Several distance learning courses are offered at this great American based university and these courses are collectively offered by over 25 campuses. At University of Wisconsin-Madison, you are offered a choice of choosing form a wide variety of distance learning courses with several undergraduate programs, masters programs and lots of other non-degree certificate programs. Courses are offered in the fields of communication, management and liberal studies to nursing and political science.

5.Pennsylvania State University
Pennsylvania State University is among the oldest American universities. It began offering correspondence courses in 1892, among the first schools to embark on such. The university started distance education in 1998, and currently is offering more than 100 online education programs, certificates and degrees in business, education, engineering, technology and lots more.

6.Stanford University
Among the universities offering distance education online, Stanford University stands out as it offers free lifelong learning lectures and courses. This prestigious university also offers cooperate education fully online, at company work sites, on campus and even through combining methods.

7.University of California, Berkeley
This is one of the top universities in the world offering undergraduate education. This university offers online distance education and aspirants can choose from several courses that carry transferable academic credit. The University of California Berkley Extension offers full study programs and certificates in fields like business analysis, advanced biosciences, and marketing.

8.Northeastern university
A nonprofit institution that became a figurehead in corporative education, this prestigious university has attained a network of over 203,000 alumni worldwide. Recognized by The Carnegie Classification of Institutions of Higher Education as a university with high interdisciplinary research activity, Northeastern University offers a wide variety of field of study with discipline ranging from engineering technology and electronics, accounting and finance, medical and pharmaceutical studies and also legal studies.

9.Rochester Institute of Technology
A privately run university, this institution is a pioneer in distance education and offers flexible learning openings through a modular approach to curriculums. It offers several graduate and undergraduate degrees, including fixed courses to choose from.

10.Washington State University
Washington State University is a prominent university founded in 1890. In 2012, it established its online global campus, with the aim of exposing its academic programs to a wider audience. In this school, students can find bachelors, masters and non-degree certificates for both graduates and undergraduates.

latest-posts.title: Top 5 high paying government jobs
latest-posts.body:
The world is growing fast and things are changing. Private sector is one aspect where growth is recorded because more people are learning to become entrepreneurs and self-reliant. Even though the private sector is growing faster than ever, government jobs still remains among the wide known and sought after career choices available to youths and undergrads. There are many factors that attracts youths to government jobs, and the biggest factors are career stability, prestige and social status, amenities and perk structures, excellent pay, and minimum educational qualifications required for different types of jobs.

When it comes to government jobs after schooling, there are vast opportunities available for candidates. Several government agencies and sectors carryout yearly recruitment exercises providing opportunities for government job lovers. If you are longing for a government job, below are top five government jobs that you can choose from:

1.Administrative services
One of the most sought after government jobs is the administrative service, and this job is particularly one of the most sought after jobs especially in India. Aspirants have to appear for the annual examination conducted for openings available for this job. In India, Indian administrative services (IAS) officers are generally appointed as the main administrators as district administrators or for a complete governmental department.

2.Revenue services
This is the next most sought after job profile. Officers of the revenue services are selected from exams conducted for this purpose. Eligible candidates are appointed under the department for revenue service. Their jobs mainly include collecting and monitoring revenue for security, development and governance. To add to it, top revenue service officers also take advisory part in drafting and formulating the country’s taxation policies. 

3.Foreign service
If you are attracted to foreign matters and affairs, then it is advisable that you go for Foreign Service. Exams are set for candidates too, and successful candidates will be screened. The duties of Foreign Service officials include conducting diplomatic operation and also formulation and implementation of foreign policy matters for the country.

4.Police service
Nowadays youths are attracted to police service than ever before. We all should know what police officers do; they are responsible for and act as defenders of the law and order at various levels and positions. New recruits start from a level such as Assistant Superintendent of Police where they are generally promoted over the years to Commissioner of Police and Director General of Police, all depending on the situation at hand. Generally, officers of the police services enjoy punitive and investigative powers and other administrative functions.

5.Staff selection commission jobs
This agency is responsible for recruiting personnel and staff for the various governmental departments. The SSC organize exams based recruitment for various departments/ministries of the government. This agency conducts various level examinations to recruit candidates for various office and field jobs of the central government.

The jobs mention above are mainly related to Indians and students studying in India looking for high paying government jobs should go after any of the above listed courses.

latest-posts.title: 15 tips for PHD students in their first week
latest-posts.body:
All beginnings are tough, as you have to cope with the challenges faced as a fresher. The beginning of your PhD isn’t an exception. The goal of your first days as a PhD student is to be ready as soon as possible to start your research. This article is to help you coup with your first week during your PhD. Read until the end, as you will find it useful.

1.Find a coffee mug
This is necessary because your PhD won’t be relaxed as you thought, because you have to work hard and sometimes only coffee can keep you awake when you are on your computer. You had better be ready now so as to be productive.

2.Get your desk and chair
This is necessary as you will spend long hours doing research. You should choose a comfortable chair. This will help you to avoid lower back pain while you do your research.

3.Do the paper work
Most likely, when you begin your PhD, you will have to give personal and contact details, fill in several forms and give out lots of details about you. It is better you get these ready on time so as to be focused on your PhD.

4.Have access to university building
Since you will be working in a school environment, it is vital that you have access to it because the building might have some security measures put in place. You are going to work in the weekends also, therefore its better you get permission to be in the building anytime you want to work.

5.Get a computer
You will need a PC, so get yours along with you, and if you already don’t have, order for one. Your PC should be connected to the web so as to enable your research run faster. You should also get a printer and other necessary computing items like software, access to shared drives and others.
Important note! If you will be using your Laptop, get a lock so that it won’t be stolen from you.

6.Stock office supplies
Whatever you can do to get them, please do because such office supplies as stock post-its, a stapler, highlighters, paperclips, a few pens and some notebooks are useful for your PhD.

7.Make the secretary your friend
You might think that your professor is the most powerful person when it comes to your PhD, but you are wrong. The secretary, who controls the professor’s agenda, can help you squeeze an appointment no matter how crowded the agenda is. So make her your friend.

8.Register to courses
You need to have a clear vision on the courses available to you, the compulsory ones, the optional ones and the ones that are nice to do. Whatever the case, it is wise to sit with your boss and discuss about the courses that will benefit you the most.

9.Download papers to read
You will be reading lots of papers at the beginning of your PhD, so don’t only ask your boss which ones you should read, go get them, plenty books and papers related to your research topic and read. To find papers to read, use Google Scholar, ask your Liberian and also make use of PubMed.

10.Start a literature review
You need to start doing literature review, gather papers, read and summarise them then organise your learning. If you engage in proper literature review, the overview of your field will be more accurate and your whole work more easier.

11.Check previous thesis of your group
This is important because you can know the type of topics preferred in your group, how a PhD is structured in your faculty, how many papers PhD’s published before graduating and many more.

12.Craft a research plan
Although this might sound awkward to you, still you can give it a try by splitting your PhD into 4-6 blocks, with each one well defined to produce a publication. Make the design to make your initial project easy so as to yield results earlier as this will be a motivating factor for you.

13.Meet your supervisor/professor
You need to meet with your professor to ensure that both of you are on the same track and are in agreement on what you will be doing and how you choose to do it.

14.Meet your new colleagues
Meeting your colleagues is important so that you know what their project is all about and what contributions and help you can offer to each other.

15.Be social
Being social will help you a lot. Make friends; invite your colleagues for coffee breaks, lunch, or any social gatherings. This will help you gain more friends and support as your life isn’t restricted to your research alone.
latest-posts.excerpt: All beginnings are tough, as you have to cope with the challenges faced as a fresher. The beginning of your PhD isn’t an exception.

latest-posts.title: 5 steps in managing public speaking anxiety
latest-posts.body:
Everyone has that fear of addressing the public, especially for the first time. We don’t want to make mistakes when we speak in a public gathering. Whatever the cause of your public speaking anxiety, you can overcome it with these five steps:

1.Face your fear
Before you resolve any problem you are facing, the first thing is to be realistic and admit that such a problem exists. Acknowledge that it exists, and have faith that you will overcome it. When you become courageous enough to face your fear, then you will overcome it.

2.Be knowledgeable of what you will deliver
It will be of great help to you if you know your material thoroughly, not only memorizing it. You have to have good knowledge of the information you want to pass across, the main message and your key points. To be calm and relaxed on stage, just be prepared.

3.Don’t think it’s all about you
When making a public speech or addressing a crowd, we mostly think that everyone is looking at us, and thus this will make us uncomfortable. Before making a public speech, we need to adjust the way we see things. Change your mindset and know that although everybody in the room is looking at us, in reality, half of them are more interested in the message or content we are delivering, while their own thoughts and other irrelevant things carry the rest away. 

4.Interact with your audience
When addressing the public, a big way to release the tension in you and free yourself from public speaking anxiety is by interacting with your audience. This can be done by getting them engaged and doing certain things like asking leading questions, bring up a story you can relate to and many more. As you interact with them and in getting them engaged, you’ll surely be more comfortable and your audience too will feel relaxed. One interesting thing you might not know is that interacting with your audience will make you a more engaging and dynamic speaker. 

5.Think about the worst thing that will happen
In life, when faced with problems, we are often filled with worries and fears, fear of the worst happening to us. It will amuse you to know that just asking yourself of the worst thing that can happen in any problem you face can be a magical way of resolving problems and overcoming fears and worries. Just like in all life problems, asking yourself of the worst thing that will happen when addressing the public will work wonders for you, as it will free you of public speaking anxiety. Fear of your hand shaking, you making mistakes as you deliver your speech, panic, fretting or any other fears can come into your mind. Firstly, it’s unlikely for any of these problem to happen; but what if it happens? Simple, you pick up yourself, dust yourself off and live to fight another day. Making mistakes is part of life and business, so also public speaking.
In conclusion, you don’t have to worry about public speaking. The above tips will help you out if you have public speaking anxiety.
latest-posts.excerpt: Everyone has that fear of addressing the public, especially for the first time. We don’t want to make mistakes when we speak in a public gathering.

latest-posts.title: 7 apps for cataloging your home library
latest-posts.body:
It is a wise idea to catalog your home library, however, you might get stuck as to which app will enable you achieve this aim of yours graciously. Because of this, we have gathered seven apps that will help you a lot in terms of organizing your books and other collections. Below are seven apps for cataloging your home library.

1.Libib
This is a wonderful app that allows you to organize your books (even music, movies and other media) through tagging. You can make notes about borrowing with the built-in annotation features of this app. This app basically has limitless size, having space for up to 100,000 items. There are other handy tools of this app; tools that make it possible for you to take measurement of how much you have read. Another wonderful feature of this app is that you can review items in your library and also make the reviews public. Libib is free and can be used for both iOS and android platforms. It can also be accessed via web.

2.iBookshelf   
You will love this app because it comes with preinstalled borrowing status for every item. It has a barcode scanning feature that makes it easy to use, and this app automatically calls up available info of every book by the ISBN entered. This app isn’t free, but it’s cheap. It costs just $1.99 and is available only for iPhone and iPad users.

3.Libri 
An ideal app for cataloguing, Libri allows you to enter simple info about every single item such as author, ISBN, publisher, year, title, and simple annotation. Although this app has few features, it is nevertheless an easy to learn app. This app, just like iBookshelf costs $1.99 and is open for iPhone, iPad and iPad touch users.

4.My library
With this app, you can input information via barcode scanning or ISBN. In addition, this app has cataloguing features that allows you to catalog any kind of media you have, not only books. There are other fascinating features of this app, and some of such features are allowing you to rate items, handling up to 8,000 items at a time, and streamlined backup options. This app is available for iPhone, iPad and iPad touch. It is sold for $3.99.

5.Book crawler
Users can make use of ISBN or barcode scanning with this app that generates associated information for each item such as reviews and titles. This app has the ability to export to DropBox for easy backup. As the highest-rated book database app in iTunes, this app costs $1.99 and is usable on iPhone, iPad, iPad touch and Mac desktop.
6.Home library
Home library is unique as it doesn’t just let you catalogue and track loan status of each item in your library, it also makes it possible for you to send polite reminders to your friends who are still with the books they borrowed from you. With this app, it is easy for you to track easily books that you’ve checked out from the library, and before they are due, it sends you reminders. With this, you can say goodbye to late fees. This app also accommodates wish list and works for iPad, iPad touch, iPhone, Mac OS X and Android devices. It cost $2.99.

7.iCollect books pro
This app is well known for its barcode scanning or manual UPCISBN entry, genre sorting, tacking loans and lots more. It costs $2.99 and can be used on iPhone, iPad and iPad touch.
These are 7 apps for cataloguing your home library. Which cataloguing app do you use that isn’t listed here?

latest-posts.title: 3 Fat-Loss Myths – Debunked
latest-posts.body:
Have you ever tried losing weight, thought you were doing everything correctly, and still didn’t see the progress you wanted? Sure, there are a number of reasons why you weren’t seeing the results, but what if the changes you made to your diet weren’t actually that helpful–or even downright useless?

There are numerous myths surrounding the “best” eating plans and nutrition protocols for successful (and rapid) weight loss. Unfortunately, these myths often become prominent hallmarks within the programs of unknowing individuals who pursue their fitness goals with misguided information. They find themselves bound to unhelpful, sometimes dangerous eating rules for years on end before they discover it’s been for naught.

In this article I’ll cover three popular fat-loss myths, all relevant to concerns regarding metabolism–the chemical process within your body responsible for producing and burning energy (calories).

Myth #1: Metabolism Can’t Be Altered

With the release of a New York Times article discussing the unfortunate outcome of many “Biggest Loser” contestants, many people come to believe that their metabolism is out of their control. Fortunately, this isn’t completely true. While prolonged weight loss can cause “metabolic adaptation” (the slowing of your metabolism to adjust to the new level of nutrient intake), a regular strength-training routine can help combat this adaptation by increasing one’s resting metabolic rate—the number of calories one burns at rest. This occurs because muscle is “metabolically active,” meaning muscle tissue requires extra energy to maintain itself. This extra energy needed for maintenance and growth of muscle tissue can slow the rate of this metabolic slowdown, and help increase metabolic rate once a goal weight is reached.

Additionally, more modest calorie restrictions can help prevent unnecessary metabolic adaptation. A good rule of thumb is to eat the most amount of calories that still allows you to lose weight. This not only slows down the rate of metabolic adaptation, but will also leave you with additional wiggle room to further reduce calories when your program calls for it.
Myth #2: Small, Frequent Meals Help Stoke The “Metabolic Fire.” 

There was an old belief that small frequent meals would speed up metabolism, because just like a fire, constantly supplying the body with nutrients would keep the “metabolic fire” aflame. However, research conducted on this subject found that eating only two meals a day, compared to three meals a day, had no effect on total energy expenditure throughout the day.

Does this mean frequent meals are a waste of time? Not necessarily, as more frequent meals may be able to help individuals better control total calorie consumption (by avoiding binge-like eating behaviors). However, some individuals find it easier to eat fewer meals throughout the day, both as a way to help control appetite and because it simply fits better with their lifestyle. The best approach is to find an eating frequency that works for you–allowing you to successfully eat the proper amount of nutrients while maintaining a modest calorie deficit.

Myth #3: Calories Eaten Late At Night Will Turn to Fat

Numerous studies have shown a correlation between late night eating and weight gain. However, this weight gain was likely caused as a result of total caloric over-consumption, and not because of its effect on their metabolism. In other words, late-night snack eaters consume more calories because they are ingesting additional food when their non-snacking counterparts are sleeping or engaging in other, non-food related activities. The research is clear: as long as you remain in a calorie deficit, consuming a meal close to bedtime does not increase fat accumulation more than a meal consumed during normal daytime hours.

If eating close to bedtime (such as in an intermittent fasting diet) works best for your lifestyle, go right ahead. Some individuals might even find it easier to fall asleep when they aren’t trying to ignore hunger pangs because they haven’t eaten since 4pm.

The realities behind these myths provide some promising insights:

• Metabolism is a dynamic process. Yes, it adapts and slows down the longer you remain on a weight-loss diet, but you can also combat and reverse this effect through strength training and gradual calorie changes.
• Meal frequency has a much smaller affect on fat accumulation than previously believed. (Almost negligible.) This means you have much more freedom to time your meals in a manner that fits best with your lifestyle–making your nutrition plan easier to maintain.
• As long as you remain in a modest calorie deficit, eating just before bed is OK. So if you’re like me and enjoy a bedtime snack before getting some shuteye, go on with your Halo-Top eating self.

Sure, there are a number of reasons why you weren’t seeing the results, but what if the changes you made to your diet weren’t actually that helpful–or even downright useless?

latest-posts.title: 7 Habits to Lose Weight with any Diet
latest-posts.body:
When it comes to weight loss, the concern of most people is trying to select the most effective diet. No doubt some diets are more recommendable than others, but in the long term the results depend more on habits than on specific diets.

If you see change as something temporary, you will surely fail. When you go back to your usual habits, the usual kilos will come back, plus some extra.

You must of course choose a good eating plan, but then focus on the new habits to develop. In this article you will learn about the habits that are usually associated with long-term success, and concrete ideas for incorporating them. 

1. Allow some flexibility (Flexible Control).

Very restrictive diets are difficult to maintain over time. Eliminating foods you enjoy forever
reduces adherence by requiring too much willpower. In addition, we want more of what we
can't have, and this rigid control raises the risk of cravings (study) and possibly binge eating.
On the other hand, excessive flexibility is also negative. To achieve certain goals you must
make certain sacrifices, and that means setting limits for yourself.

That ideal balance point is what some studies call "flexible control," which will vary from
person to person.

Maintaining flexible control involves paying attention to food and following certain guidelines, but understanding that your progress doesn't stop because you have your favorite pizza for dinner one day. It's about prioritizing real food and being mindful of portions, without self-punishing or blaming yourself if one day you overeat or eat something undesirable.

While this flexible control facilitates the maintenance of lost weight, rigid control is
associated with worse long-term results. In addition, rigid control can lead to a dangerous obsession with achieving a supposed dietary purity. When you fail in this impossible mission, you break down, worsening your results. 

Avoid the all-or-nothing mentality. Seek progress, not perfection.

2. Reduce snacks

The belief that we should eat five or six meals a day is a recent one. In the 1970s most people ate three large meals a day, but this number increased over time.On the one hand, nutritional recommendations leaned toward smaller meals, thinking that this would better control hunger and keep metabolism high (both ideas are wrong). On the other hand, the food industry increased its promotion of mid-morning and mid-afternoon snacks.

They knew that if we increase the number of daily intakes we will tend to eat more, and big
stomachs are more profitable than small ones. Thus, the average number of meals increased from the typical three meals a day just a few decades ago to the current five or six. Calories from snacks have increased in all age ranges, contributing to the current caloric excess Snacks are adding more and more calories. 

3. Cook more and eat out less

Cooking is one of the best skills you can develop. It's not about elaborating sophisticated
dishes, but about defending yourself with the basics. In the time Master Chef lasts, you can
prepare food for several days. You will also avoid exposing yourself to their misleading
propaganda.

Cooking more at home and eating less in restaurants are habits that are associated with less weight gain .

When cooking you have much more control over your meals, both their size and their
ingredients. You will certainly use better oils and lower calorie sauces.

If you eat out often, try to follow some rules:
1. Tell them not to put bread or snacks on the table.
2. If you order salad, have them serve the sauce on the side, or simply add oil and
vinegar.
3. Ask them to swap undesirable side dishes (such as chips) for some salad.
4. You don't have to eat everything on your plate. Eating more than you need is also
wasting food, and you will carry the excess with you in the form of fat. Besides, in most
restaurants you can take the leftovers with you.
5. Skip dessert, or just order a piece of fruit.

4. Reconnect with your body's signals

If you have followed a strict diet, for example a ketogenic or PSMF approach, you have
probably had to count calories and macronutrients. This has benefits and I recommend doing it for a while, but if you do it consistently you raise the risk of disconnecting from your body.

Once you are at your ideal weight, you must learn to reconnect with your body's internal
signals, stopping eating when you are satisfied, without becoming full. This is precisely what is recommended by the millenary Japanese technique of Hara hachi bu, or 80% belly.
The goal is for your body, not your phone, to tell you when to stop eating. 

To achieve this, you must be more conscious when eating, and this is precisely the following recommendation.

5. Be more conscious when eating

We make more than 200 food decisions a day, most of them unconscious (detail). If you don't think about what you eat and don't control your portions, you will be at the mercy of your impulses and easily manipulated by commercial interests. 

In fact, this process of awareness should begin long before you sit down at the table. When
you go shopping, take a list with you. Don't buy anything that is not on the list if you don't
need it, even if it is on sale. Refuse free samples.

At mealtime, chew calmly and pay attention ,avoiding eating in front of the TV or in the
presence of any other distraction (like checking Instagram). Eat the allotted portion and do not repeat, unless you are really hungry.

Don't eat directly from the fridge or packaging. Take out the portion, serve it on a plate and
save the rest.

In short, it's about becoming more aware of the choices you make around food, and that
increased awareness will improve your behavior (meta-analysis).Remind yourself often why you do this. Aligning your behavior with your values improves your ability to self-regulate, tolerate uncomfortable feelings, and become more aware of your decisions.

6. Weigh yourself frequently

I know this recommendation is not very popular, but the evidence is clear. People who weigh
themselves frequently lose more weight and regain less weight. People who weigh themselves more frequently lose more weight. 

Some believe that weighing can generate anxiety, but the evidence does not seem to support this idea. And if this were to happen, it would not be the fault of the scale, but of our
relationship with weight. 

To begin with, you must understand that weight fluctuations are normal, and that your progress is measured by many other variables (measurements, muscle, performance, energy level...). Furthermore, if you gain two kilos of muscle and lose two kilos of fat, your body will look much better, even though your weight has not undergone any variation. 

But all this does not imply that you should ignore weight, but understand it and put it in
context. And above all, you should avoid linking your personal worth to the value indicated by the scale. If you allow your weight to define you, stopping weighing yourself does not solve the problem.

Another benefit of weighing yourself frequently is that you see the trend more clearly,
avoiding that punctual fluctuations make you make wrong decisions. Don't obsess about your weight, but don't ignore it either.

7. Include physical activity

Increasing physical activity, especially strength training, will not only enhance the results of the diet, but is one of the habits most strongly associated with long-term weight maintenance.
Exercise benefits us by multiple mechanisms:
1. It helps regulate appetite.
2. It improves insulin sensitivity.
3. It raises metabolism, especially strength training.
4. Increases energy expenditure.
5. It improves our mood.

Summary and conclusions
"All happy families resemble each other, but every unhappy family is unhappy in its own way" - Leo Tolstoy (Anna Karenina).

The so-called Anna Karenina principle indicates that success requires the presence of many
specific factors, while failure can be explained by the lack of any one of them. Success is
therefore a much more fragile state, since in the absence of certain conditions it will result in chaos.

latest-posts.title: 10 Causes You Don't Lose Weight
latest-posts.body:
Getting stuck in weight loss is frustrating, but these plateaus are also learning opportunities.

Below I summarize 10 common reasons why you don't lose weight and some practical ideas for overcoming them.

1. You are losing weight but you don't realize it

Your weight fluctuates from day to day due to a multitude of factors: hydration level, glycogen, stomach contents, fluid retention, menstrual cycle...

If you weigh yourself once a week and don't see any variation, you might think that you haven't lost anything. To improve monitoring I recommend weighing yourself daily and calculating the average weight for the week. Comparing the weekly average will smooth out the daily fluctuations and you will be able to see the real progress.

Evaluating progress by weekly average weight avoids being misled by daily fluctuations. This is especially relevant after the rapid losses of the first few weeks.

Also, if you are strength training (and you should be), you will gain muscle mass. This will help you burn more fat, but the total weight loss will be less.If you lose two kilos of fat and gain one kilo of muscle the scale will only reflect a total weight loss of 1 kilo, although this is very good progress. However, someone who does not strength train may lose two kilos of fat and one kilo of muscle. Looking at the scales, he or she would be very happy (3 kilos less!), even though it is a much worse result.

Also remember that weight is just one more metric of progress, not necessarily the main one. Another example: if you start supplementing with creatine it is normal to gain 1-2 kg in a short time, but it is not fat, just water. 

2. You eat more than you think

Most people underestimate the calories they eat, and the difference is especially large in the most overweight people. Many studies note deviations of 20-50%. We are clearly unaware of this error, because we continue to underreport calories even though we know they will be verified later (study) or even though we are paid to improve accuracy (study). We are very easily fooled.

Even dietitians underestimate their calories by 10%. That's less than half that of the rest of the population, but it's still a big enough error to produce stagnation. What are the most frequent calculation errors?

- We underestimate portions. What looks like 100 grams of rice to us is actually 150.
- We remember the foods that make us look good (spinach and kale) but tend to forget those we are less proud of (like donuts).
- We count the hundred calories in the salad but not the three hundred in the dressing.
- We log the coffee but not the three tablespoons of coconut oil and butter (which is why I don't recommend bulletproof coffee).
- We don't count liquid calories. Our satiety-signaling mechanisms are little influenced by liquid calories, so it's best to reduce them.
- We don't consider the small snacks we take during the day.
- How to minimize this mistake? Buy a weight like this one and record for a week everything you eat, with apps like myfitnesspal or FatSecret.

3. You don't base your diet on real food.

Calories matter, but so does their origin. Real food (minimally processed fresh food) has many benefits over more processed foods:

It is more satiating, and thus facilitates calorie control.
It requires more energy to digest, which reduces the calories that are ultimately absorbed.
It is more nutritionally dense, and micronutrients also participate in the satiety signal.

The result is that by basing food on real food, weight loss is more easily achieved (study).
Diets based on fresh foods facilitate weight loss, those based on ultra-processed foods promote the opposite.

4. You don't eat enough protein

Protein-rich diets improve body composition in several ways: 

They increase satiety. Protein is the most satiating macronutrient.

They increase thermogenesis. Some 20-30% of protein calories are expended in their own digestion, making it difficult to ultimately be stored as fat.

They minimize muscle loss. Or even facilitate muscle gain if the diet is
accompanied by strength training. What level of protein is ideal for weight loss? Between 1.5 and 2 grams per kg of weight per day.

5. You relax too much on the weekend

Many people do well with their diet during the week but relax too much on the weekend. There is no problem in including days with more calories (and we will see that it even has benefits), but if you increase the consumption of alcohol and ultra-processed foods from Friday to Sunday (in addition to reducing physical activity) you will ruin all the progress of the week.

6. You do not sleep well (or enough)

Sleep deficit damages metabolism by multiple mechanisms . It makes us lose insulin sensitivity, reduces anabolic hormones and increases hunger. We also become more impulsive and find it difficult to control our appetite. If you want to lose weight, pay attention to sleep.

7. You have been dieting for a long time

If you have a lot of fat to lose you must spend months in caloric deficit, and your body interprets that as a threat. Its defense strategy is to slow down metabolism and reduce energy expenditure. In extreme cases it disables entire systems, such as the reproductive system.The result is that losing weight becomes increasingly difficult, and continuing to
drop calories only makes the problem worse.

After a certain point you should start to include reloads or even whole weeks of rest, where you return to your maintenance calories. This way you reverse the metabolic adaptations that slow down your progress and restart your weight loss, as well as allowing you a psychological respite.

Paradoxically, eating more will help you lose weight.

8. You move not enough

Losing weight through diet alone is possible, but not recommended. For starters, you will lose more muscle mass, damaging your aesthetics and your health. In addition, after a certain point, cutting more calories will become too hard, and will only increase your appetite and frustration. Adding physical activity is the solution.

When thinking about energy expenditure we tend to focus on the workout, ignoring the rest of the movement. However, all that low-intensity movement we do throughout the day, called NEAT or Non-Exercise Activity Thermogenesis, is often what determines whether you lose fat or plateau. 

Between two people of similar size there can be variations of up to 2,000 calories per day far more than what is possible to achieve in the hour we spend training.

By moving more you will be able to eat more while still losing weight, the dietary holy grail. Technically we call this effect "high energy flow", which makes the process much more bearable.

9. Your microbiota is altered
Our bacteria influence countless metabolic processes, many of them associated with weight regulation. For example, butyrate produced by your bacteria in the colon reduces appetite and improves metabolism (detail, detail).A poor microbiota promotes overweight. 

The type of bacteria you have (and their balance) influences your appetite for some foods or others, the amount of calories you absorb from food, the production of butyrate, your level of inflammation... and all these factors determine how easy it is for you to lose weight.

Including the right food for your bacteria will help you lose weight.

10. Taking medications

All medications have side effects, including, in some cases, weight gain. It is more difficult to lose weight with many types of antidepressants, glucocorticoids and beta-blockers.

Prolonged consumption of antibiotics is also associated with more overweight, due to its negative effect on the microbiota. Obviously you should take the medications you need, but be aware of their possible effects.
latest-posts.excerpt: Getting stuck in weight loss is frustrating, but these plateaus are also learning opportunities. Below I summarize 10 common reasons why you don't lose weight and some practical ideas for overcoming them.

latest-posts.title: Understanding the background of expansion of adipose tissue.
latest-posts.body:
When we increase our body fat, our subcutaneous adipose tissue increases, but when this is not enough to accommodate this excess energy converted into triglycerides, visceral adipose tissue begins to grow (or both at the same time), which, having less adipogenic capacity, grows by hypertrophy, that is, by increasing the size of adipocytes (cells that store fat).

When the expansion of adipose tissue from the differentiation of preadipocytes (adipogenesis) is limited, adipose tissue can only expand through hypertrophy of the adipocyte itself, in order to accommodate excess triglycerides. But its capacity is partially limited, and so a process of adipogenesis is initiated that prevents the adipocyte from expanding further by hypertrophy to critical limits. At that moment hyperplasia of the adipocyte occurs from a preadipocyte (not that the adipocyte divides in two as it is thought hehehe).

This process of hyperplasia could be considered as negative, as it allows the adipose tissue to continue increasing, but thanks to hyperplasia it is possible to continue storing energy (fattening) without any metabolic problems. But if the causes that trigger the increase in lipogenesis (such as a positive energy balance) continue, the adipose tissue becomes incompetent at storing triglycerides, making the main mode of expansion happen through adipocyte hypertrophy, which leads to health problems.

As adipocyte hypertrophy occurs, they begin to secrete proinflammatory cytokines ultimately leading to lipoinflammation and then chronic inflammation. However, hyperplasia gives us better insulin sensitivity and glucose levels are reduced, decreasing the production of pro-inflammatory cytokines.

A problem with excessive adipocyte hyperplasia is that when a fat loss process is initiated, let's say that these adipocytes lose their triglyceride content as we lose weight, but are not eliminated in number, making it easier to regain the lost weight later on.
